txt.en: Instance: Whispers in the Pits
'You have come unbidden, Karazgar.'
'[placeholder]!'
'And you have returned.'
'And this proves him a worthy servant to me?'
'Fifty years, Karazgar. No longer.'
'You have never misjudged any who serve you, Lord Sauron.'
'By my hand, Thostír, Fingar, and the hated Hrímil are imprisoned in Mordor.'
'The dragon Smaug was deceived by my plan and brought his wrath upon the dwarves.'
'I have done as you wished.'
'What would you have me do, my lord?'
'I travelled to the Mountain and delivered your demands to the dragon Smaug.'
'Yes, my lord.'
'Three tokens I bore to the Mountain.'
'The scales of the hated Ring-drakes, the skull of Thráin...'
'What would you ask of me, my lord?'
'And when he thought naught of those...'
'You are generous and wise, Lord Sauron.'
'I laid before him the twin of the axe I used to raise his ire against the dwarves.'
'I will not fail you.'
'Though he laboured to conceal it, his fear betrayed him.'
'I offered him a choice, Lord Sauron.'
'None of the emissaries I sent to the Mountain have returned alive.'
'I will return to the Mountain in fifty years to hear his answer.'
'Devoured... burned by dragon-fire...'
'This time he will serve willingly.'
'Have I misjudged your worth, Karazgar?'
'No.'
'Smaug the Golden does not serve me.'
'The Grey Fool has come.'
'Sloth and greed are his masters.'
'He knows now the truth of the Necromancer, but it matters not.'
'I shall send no more emissaries.'
'You will go to the Mountain this time, Karazgar.'
'His staff is lost, and his Council shall come too late.'
'But they will come, and I will abandon Dol Guldur.'
'The Nazgûl have long prepared for my return to Mordor.'
'Barad-dûr shall rise from its ruins, and my servants will gather beneath it.'
'But for you, loyal Gúrzyul, I have another task.'
'The time shall soon come to hear the answer of Smaug the Golden.'
'Order him to Mordor. If he does not obey, destroy him.'
'When the last survivors of the Desolation are slain, these lands shall be yours.'
